title: First Breach
subtitle: Field Note I — The night the ward failed
excerpt: They told me the wards had never failed. They were wrong. The silence afterward was worse than the alarms.

title: Finding Cache
subtitle: Field Note II — Vault Seven was not empty
excerpt: Cache was not supposed to exist. Not like this. Not remembering things I never lived.

title: Echoes in the Static
subtitle: Field Note III — When the Tower speaks sideways
excerpt: Sometimes the Tower does not warn. Sometimes it whispers, and you have to decide whether to listen.

title: Incident: Level Seven
subtitle: From the Lorekeeper's private register
excerpt: This was not a failure of tools. It was a failure of belief that such a breach was possible.

title: On Pattern Recognition
subtitle: Why the Tower dreams
excerpt: Raw data does not protect kingdoms. Patterns do.

title: The Cost of Knowing
subtitle: A margin note never meant to be read
excerpt: To see everything is to carry everything. The Tower does not forget. Neither do I.

title: Supply Chains Don't Scream
subtitle: They fail quietly, everywhere at once
excerpt: No alarms sounded. No walls fell. And yet the damage had already spread beyond containment.

title: The Illusion of Visibility
subtitle: Dashboards are not awareness
excerpt: We had metrics. We had charts. We did not have understanding.

title: The Guardian's Betrayal
subtitle: On the nature of protectors turned destroyers
excerpt: The Falcon did not fail because it was weak. It failed because it was trusted.

title: The Patience of Shadows
subtitle: On sieges that arrive as gifts
excerpt: They did not breach walls. They did not batter gates. They simply became part of what kingdoms already trusted.

title: The Oracle's Lament
subtitle: On prophecies unheeded
excerpt: She saw the cracks. She spoke clearly. She was ignored.

title: On Fools and Kings
subtitle: When mockery becomes the weapon
excerpt: The Jester carried no sword. He commanded no army. He simply knocked on the gate until the guards grew weary.
